https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-hoc3/le.short_instructions: Authors use literal language to paint a picture in the reader's mind. You can add sprites to illustrate the poem.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-hoc3/le.long_instructions:
Authors use imagery to paint a picture in the reader's mind. You can add sprites to illustrate the poem. 

-   Connect a `make new sprite` block under the `when run` block.
-   Choose a costume for your sprite.
-   Press "Run."

_Extra Challenge:_ Use an **event** to make a new sprite appear when a new character is introduced!

authored_hints.location_hint:
Each sprite has a **location**. You can set the location by clicking the pin on this block: 

[blockly block][0]

-   Click the pin [][1] on the location block then choose a new position for your sprite on the screen.
-   Press the "Run" button when your code is finished.

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-hoc3/le.short_instructions: Sprites can have their own behaviors, which are actions they will do over and over while the program runs.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-hoc3/le.long_instructions:
Sprites can have their own behaviors, which are actions they will do over and over while the program runs.

-   Drag out a behavior block, the `sprite begins` block.
-   Explore different behaviors.

_Extra Challenge:_ Use an **event** to make a sprite begin a behavior when the mood shifts!

https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-hoc3/le.short_instructions: You can change the size of a sprite you already made.
https://studio.code.org/s/poetry-hoc3/le.long_instructions:
You can change the **size** of a sprite you already made.

-   Change the size of your sprite by using the new `set size` block. 
-   Replace `50` with another size, like `150`.

_Extra Challenge:_ Use an **event** and the new blocks to change the size of a sprite _or_ remove it completely when the **mood** of the poem shifts!
